    Netskope Overview

    www.netskope.com
    Santa Clara, CA
    501 to 1000 employees
    2012
    Company - Private
    Enterprise Software & Network Solutions
    Unknown / Non-Applicable
    Netskopeâ¢ is the leader in safe cloud enablement. Only the Netskope Active Platformâ¢ enables you to find, understand, and secure sanctioned and unsanctioned cloud apps. With Netskope, IT can direct usage, protect sensitive data, and ensure compliance in ... Read more

    Mission: It's our mission to help people safely use their favorite cloud apps so that business can move fast, with confidence.

    We believe everyone works better when they are free to use the best tools for the job. Tools that make them fast. Agile. Efficient. Those tools are quickly becoming cloud apps.

    But how can organizations really embrace cloud apps if they canât see which ones are in their environment? Canât understand their usage? Canât enforce policies in them?

    Our mission is to eliminate this catchâ22 so you can enable people and the business to use the apps they love. Pick the best tool for job. Be agile. Collaborate. Work from anywhere.

    Thereâs something in it for you, too. We strive to simplify your life by making Netskope ridiculously easyâtoâuse so you can quickly get a handle on those cloud apps, whether theyâre sanctioned by you or âShadow ITâ. No matter where. Or on what device.

    If this sounds good to you, try Netskope. We promise you will be glad you did.

    See clouds in your coffee?

    Netskope is tackling one of the key information technology challenges of the next ten years. Sitting at the intersection of cloud, big data, and security, the company is building the platform that will enable organizationsâ adoption of cloud computing.

    At Netskope, we have assembled a world-class team. This is a group of people that is as down-to-earth as they are experts in their field. Itâs a group that values scrappiness and smarts, and where the best ideas win. Whiteboard jockeys need not apply.     Our âcanât loseâ culture is one in which politics isnât tolerated, the CEOâs desk is in the middle of the office, and customer feedback is front-and-center on the company whiteboard. Itâs where we celebrate our victories, then turn around and strive to do even better. The confident team, clear direction, and simple âcustomer-firstâ philosophy makes for an honest set of conversations around the table and a ton of transparency throughout the organization.

    We are looking for A+ players across all functions.

    The stages of safe cloud enablement

    Find

    See all cloud apps running in your environment and assess their risk. Get details like compliance certifications, security and audit features, business continuity capabilities, and legal terms that make an app enterprise-readyâ¦or not. Quickly measure spend on unsanctioned apps and identify redundancies.

    Understand

    Drill into activity- and data-level usage details. Answer questions like âAre any unauthorized users downloading PII from any of our HR apps?,â or âWhat sensitive content do we have in our sanctioned cloud storage app, regardless of when it was uploaded?â Detect anomalous behavior that could signal compromised credentials, non-compliant behavior, or even malware. Create activity audit trails following a suspected event.

    Secure

    Rather than block apps, enforce granular policies like âBlock sharing if itâs to someone outside of the companyâ or âEncrypt any PII found in our sanctioned cloud storage app.â These policies let you say âyesâ while addressing the real risks. And donât forget to coach users with automated messages to create transparency. Let them talk back by reporting a false positive or entering a justification.

    Read more

    Interviewing at Netskope

    1. Oct 28, 2015

      Helpful (2)  

      Software Engineer Interview

      Anonymous Interview Candidate in Los Altos, CA
      No Offer
      Positive Experience
      Average Interview

      Application

      I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Netskope (Los Altos, CA).

      Interview

      I talked to a recruiter and was emailed about an opportunity following that talk. Met on site for an interview and had 3-4 hours of technical questions. The interview was standard and everything was fair.

      Interview Questions

      • BST Questions   1 Answer
      Netskope 2015-10-28 10:15 PDT
